I really like this idea, however I wonder if there is a simpler implementation such as using Timecop and an environment variable... something like this in an initializer maybe:

if ENV['SEASON'].present?
  Timecop.travel(DateTime.now.change(year: ENV['SEASON'].to_i))
end

You would then start up the dev environment with SEASON=2018 rails s and every object that extends off Time will think the year is 2018.

body:
I really like this idea, however I wonder if there is a simpler implementation such as using [Timecop](https://github.com/travisjeffery/timecop) and an environment variable... something like this in an initializer maybe:

``` Ruby
if ENV['SEASON'].present?
  Timecop.travel(DateTime.now.change(year: ENV['SEASON'].to_i))
end
```

You would then start up the dev environment with `SEASON=2018 rails s` and every object that extends off Time will think the year is 2018.
